segments.text: My eyes keep returning to the boy on the stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That two-step stool looks incredibly unstable, I must say.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Its legs are definitely splayed, and it's tilted precariously backward.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's stretched so far, reaching for those cookies, completely unaware of the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Any sudden movement, even a small shift, could send him tumbling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Heâ€™s holding a plate, which might make his balance even worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor is wet near the sink, and a fall could be nasty if he slips on water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I'm just waiting for the moment it finally gives way under him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It gives me a knot in my stomach just watching him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister isn't helping, distracting him with her own cookie quest.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope he manages to get down safely, cookies or not.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole cookie expedition feels like an accident waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a wonder he hasn't lost his balance already.
segments.speaker: PAR
